newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania parliament passes law on vote for monarchy.
newsitem.headline: Albania parliament passes law on vote for monarchy.

text.p: Albania's parliament passed a law on Tuesday to allow a referendum on restoring the monarchy to take place on the same day as planned parliamentary elections.
Parliament approved a decree by President Sali Berisha to hold the vote with 61 in favour, five against and five abstentions in the 140-seat chamber, politicians said.
The elections are expected to be held on June 29.
Long-exiled King Leka, who fled in the face of invading Italian fascists 58 years ago, hopes to persuade Albanians to restore the monarchy and has been touring the country.
He hopes to take advantage of the disillusionment and anger of Albanians in the wake of riots in February and March after the collapse of pyramid investment schemes.
When Leka visits towns he is generally received by large crowds although it is not certain whether Albanians are prepared to bring the monarchy back.
